intro: Hemistegia mexicana, commonly known as the Mexican hemistegia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves with a rough texture. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, often in axillary inflorescences. Hemistegia mexicana is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
